Posts.Content: i was rxd in feb 2011 stage 4 br cancer.  Then the dr said no reason for surgery cause it has spread.  Now 1 yr later he sez wanna do surgery.  He sayd the are speculating the main tumor feeds the new once thru a big word that it sends thru the blood.  And surgery may starve off the new growths.  Years ago i heard that when surgery was done the air hittinthe cancer cells made them grow faster.  Don't know what to think.  Has anyone's dr. suggested this to them,  my scans show the chemo did remarkably well at shrinking the growths.
Posts.Title: what to do

Posts.Content: i have been dealing with stage 4 triple positive b.c. for 3.5 yrs.  my tumor markers were always below 25, now tey have started to climb and the dr is concerned  just how high are some tumor markers recoreded at?? im m curious, mine are only up to 29 and that doesn't seem all that high to me.  any thoughts on this matter are appreciated.  how high do they go//
Posts.Title: tumoro markers

Posts.Content: thank you for your input.  the doctor seemed a bit concerned so naturally it put a red flag up for me.   had tests done on jan 5  and the results show there are no new spots so  am holding my own.
Posts.Title: tumoro markers

Posts.Content: are you sure that the pain is from the herceptin.   i have been on it for a year with no side effects.  i couldnt handle the arimidex though, it effected my joints to the point i could barely stand up.  i was given a pill for itching ATARAX (there have a generic form) long before i was diagnosed with breast cancer.  i have read that itching can be caused by cancer.  The atarax works amazing and it even helps me sleep, on rare occasions i take a quater of a pill if i can't sleep. i basically dont have trouble sleeping though.   good luck in the future
Posts.Title: Body pain after chemo tx and radiation

Posts.Content: thanks for the response. it is appreciated and also comforting to know they can go to much higher leels.  tests were redone yesterday  waiting for results.  thanks again
Posts.Title: tumoro markers

Posts.Content: are you sure that the pain is from the herceptin.   i have been on it for a year with no side effects.  i couldnt handle the arimidex though, it effected my joints to the point i could barely stand up.  i was given a pill for itching ATARAX (there have a generic form) long before i was diagnosed with breast cancer.  i have read that itching can be caused by cancer.  The atarax works amazing and it even helps me sleep, on rare occasions i take a quater of a pill if i can't sleep. i basically dont have trouble sleeping though.   good luck in the future
Posts.Title: Body pain after chemo tx and radiation

Posts.Content: dearest claudia413 thankyou for your unput it is truly appreciated
Posts.Title: what to do

Posts.Content: hAS ABYONE BEEN TREATED WITH HELEVAN FOR BREAST CANCER???  I STARTED THE TREATMENT WITH TERIBLE SIDE EFFECTS  THEY HAD TO STOP.  HOW ARE OTHERS DEALING WITH IT
Posts.Title: helevan chemo

Posts.Content: i have taken arimadex and it is HELL when it comes to bone pain.  so if you get pai in a few weeks  don't rule out this possibility.  i could not take t   and they found a shot once a onth that works the same way and is more tolerable.  just mentioning   maybe you won't have that problem-- i hope not.
Posts.Title: staring new drug

Posts.Content: no my shots afre falsodex 2 shots at the same time as my herceotin and zometa
Posts.Title: staring new drug

Posts.Content: yep the all seem to effect the joints
Posts.Title: staring new drug

Posts.Content: i am stage 4 bc  up untilnow doin very well but after my showe today i discovered a terrible red rash on my lower bottom of my breast  it is very painful and i am wonderinf if others dealt with this and if it lasted very long. what are the tratments used
Posts.Title: painful rash on bottom of breast

Posts.Content: thank you for the response.  i thought diaper rash syptoms and got out the cornstarch never expected it to clear so quickly .  it was almost gone in the am.  thanks again
Posts.Title: painful rash on bottom of breast

Posts.Content: liza it's linda. I'm wondering how you are doing.  Did you have to say so long to your Marine yet.  I hope not.  I didn't write you because i didn't want to take any time away from you being with him.. I hope all is well for you.   My tests in December showed the cancer is still there but has shrunk or is holding its own.  No new growths and the old ones arent't growing right now.  It will be 2 yrs in Feb. since I was diagnosed.   I'm still going strong (just moving in a slower motion now lol).  Hang in there.   lots of love to you  Linda
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: lizamarie711 this is pipperpain and i am wondering how you are doing now from the chemo and all. Feeling any better. Hopefully you are. Just hang in there okay. lots of love linda
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: i am stage 4  b.c.  my recent scans have shown verylittle change but i have had a pain in my hip and thigh that is nauseatingly painful.  i am wondering if it could be the cancer orr just arthiritits or something. it started with the very cold weather.  i wenrt to E.R. and they morphined me and did spinal MRI but did nothing to check the hip and thigh.  after the morphine i wasnt too concerned cause i was feeling no pain.  could someone please respond with your thoughts. cancer has spread to bones and is only in the boines at this timne
Posts.Title: New pain

Posts.Content: i amstage 4 breast cancer and doing very well 3 years since i e wwas rxd. recently while watching tv i have noticed several times that it feels like my phone is on low vibration resting on my chest. when i go to answer it    it is not arounr my neck and there is really no reason for this feeling. I am wondering f anyone else has had this feeeling. its truly strange
Posts.Title: weird sensation in breast

Posts.Content: Honey, i didn't tell you this but in truth my hair loss was a minor loss in my life at that time.  My husband died of a massive heart attack the night of my first chemo.  Everyone said the chemo was too stressful on him.  We had been married 41 years.  He told me before he went to bed "i put the chemo hat sites up on the computer, put the hats you like in my watch and we'll order them in the morning". then he said" i'm going to bed i don't feel so good- i love you.." and i said"  i love you too even if we forget to say it we know its true."  at 1:14 am he came out said he had chest pains.  I got up to give him a baby aspirin and he was gone before i got back to the sofa.  Gone in a heartbeat.  My sister saw me through the rest of my treatments, i went through them in a fog.  Hair loss was minor.  I honestly don't know how i did it,, i just wanted to be with Denny.  I was supposed to be dying  not him.  There is so much I don't remember but hair loss didn't phase me.  although i remember my head being cold and wearing knitted hair bands to keep warm.  I promise you, you will make it through this.   lots of love  linda
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: thanks for the thoughts. what doesn't kill us makes us stronger.  My health is doing really well.  routine tests this month and a dr. appt on dec 28th.  that will tell the reality of the situation.  this is such a great conversation site.  everyone is so into helping each other out.  lots of love  linda
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: i am also stage 4 spread to bones.  i faithfully take my daily vitamin and calcium and vit d.  i do not like to take papin pills as i have a terrible hung over feeling the next day with headache.  i do enjoy my rice pillow heated up and placed where the pain happens to be.  It is a small pillow filles with white rice.  it is heated in the mic for 3 minutes and it holds the heat for several hours.   a do it yourself verision can be made by filling a sock with white rice tying a knot in it and heating it up.  test the time that works best with your mic.  good luck-- i hope it helps     linda
Posts.Title: Mom has stage 4 and spread to bones

Posts.Content: i did mammos every year and when i was suspicious i found new dr and new hospital.  they did mammo and discovered with ct scan that i was stage 4 already.  hosp was great and new dr was great started treatment within with 16 days of my dr appt.  all tests were immediately scheduked after my 1st dr visit.  but yes previous hosp said mammos were good.
Posts.Title: Did anyone's cancer NOT show up on Mammogram or Ultrasound?

Posts.Content: --i do not know what pain meds she is on--but do not rule out the possibility of the pain meds making her weak and tired.  If i give in and take half of a pain pill at bedtime  i am done in til 4 pm the next day.  They nauseate me and make me dreadfully tired.  I have the lowest dose possible and i cut them in half.  I am hoping this may be your mom's problem as i have stage 4 and truthfully have very little bone pain although that is where the cancer has spread.  its in my hips thighs and ribs.  Also pain meds have terrible side effects for me if i do not take them with food.  I am not trying to sound like a know -it- all  just hoping to share my experience.
Posts.Title: Mom has stage 4 and spread to bones

Posts.Content: i did the texatore with several other drugs.  I lost my hair but gave my family an ok to make fun cause I made fun myself.  one day my sis came to take me to treatment and i had 2 little rollers on the sides where i had about 10 hairs and we both cracked up when she saw me.  one day my kids were here for dinner and i told my grandson''now if you find hair in the food it aint mine'' and he said'' whats really scary is the only other one here is the dog.''  One day i said who want s dessert and pulled out a bunch of hair this was to tease my teenage grandsons and their 2 yr old sister tried to pull her hair out also.  then  she came out one day wearing a wig that was given to me and we all had a good laugh at that.  Hey, it helps to laugh.  I never wore the wig just doorags.  Your hair doesn't make up who you are, its what's inside that counts.
Posts.Title: taxotere and cytoxan vs. hair loss and side effects

Posts.Content: susier i have those available for me, but the strength is not in my body to do the pull up.  Thank you for caring enough to share a plan that you had.  The people on this site are so nice to communicate with
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: No one on this site is stupid. We share what we know in the hopes of helping others. Choices are ours to make and evryone is sharing what they know in the hopes of helping and alerting others to different situations. I am sorry that you made that statement. We are free to share our experiences and knowledge
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: i find myself wondering so often if it is the arimidex or if the cancer has found a new spot to grow.  That ,mentally, is as hard as the physical pain.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Thanks to all who have offered me input into this question.  I appreciae you sharing your experience.  God Bless
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: thanks for the input. i was really done in today.  Had to be out in oublic and could barely get out of chair.  bummer
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: i am on arimidex have mentioned to the onc that i was having alot of bone pain, it is a side efffect for sure.  I often find myself wondering if the pain is from the arimidex or from the cancer that is also growing in my bones.  It has left me feling so weak in my legs that i depend on my arm strength to pull me up.  Anyone else feeling this wat?
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: I can give you a little chuckle today.  This morning i decided to take an extra hot bath and soak for a long while.  I had my cell phone with me in case i fell.  Enjoyed the bath soo much instead of quick showers.  The humor came when it was time to get out of the tub.  OH BOY.  i suffer from all the aches and pains that come with armidex, but getting up out of the tub was a major joke.  I could have won 1st place on Americas funniest videos, what a perdicament. lol.
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: i am seriously thinking of stopping the arimidex.? I have gotten very good reports on my cancer remission, so if it comes back we can take that route again.  I am wondering if i stop the arimidex will the strength come back to my legs?  Can anyone help me with this question?
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: 3 different pill forms of estrogen blockers proved to be undesireable for my condition as they caused extreme joint problems.  Has anyone had good results with the fasodex shot?  That is my next move.  Any input from anyone would be appreciated
Posts.Title: fasodex

Posts.Content: i was rxd in feb 2011 stage 4 b.c.  it was in my ankles knees hios ilia ribs.  i'm still here and getting around well. minimal pain in my lower back. i only need aleve 2 or 3 times w eek to deal with it
Posts.Title: metastisized breast cancer to hip cancer what are my option of living

Posts.Content: the person that can help you most is a dr.  Why would you wait and ask lay people.  Don''t take chances, I was stage 4 when i was diagnosed and i had no symptoms.  Honey, get it checked out.
Posts.Title: breast

Posts.Content: We are running close in our situation.  I was diagnosed at 59, stage 4.  I saw a dr on feb 16 2011, and by march 4  i was in the chemo chair.  My cancer staff is great.  The first treatment is really the worst.  There are meds for you if you are feeling nauseated.. Skip the compozine and ask for the one that begins with a z(Zyfrom i think)  my sister is a nurse and she said that is the best there is.  Rest as much as you can--you deserve it-- and even if you don't want to rest, you probably won't have a choice.  I'm done with my chemo, and responded really well.  I had er, prog, and her2 positive.  I am now on 1 little pill a day. It has an effect on my joints .  Its an aromatase inihibitor.  Unlike you, i am putting on weight--go figure--.  Aftter my first treatment i just about lived on deviled eggs and glorified rice.  They went down good.  My sister got me little packets of flavored pedilyte to add to water to keep my electrolytes up.  My email Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection,email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines athttp://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html  ifyou want to text a friend in the same boat.   hang in there i did.  linda
Posts.Title: Do I have anything in common with you ?

Posts.Content: has anyone with b.c. had a strange sensation. almst like when you accidently stick your finger in a light socket only a bit milder?? i have had this sensaton in my leFT BREAST  WHERE THE CANCER STARTED AND NOW IT IS MUCH STRONGER IN THE RIGHT SIDE.  JUST CURIOUS, MY DOCTOR SAID SHE NEVER HEARD OF IT.  SAID POSSIBLY A nerve of some sort.  i would love to hear from some one who may have had to deal with this--it is not painful, just annoying.
Posts.Title: strange sensation

Posts.Content: i can associate with what you are saying. My torso feels a chill, if it were on my arms i would say goosebumps, but it is inside my torso, a cool chill with like a mild internal goosebump situation, weird but that's how i would explain how i feel and only sometimes not constant.  weird what we go through to try and beat this beast ain't it
Posts.Title: Aromasin - side effect: vibration sensation

Posts.Content: I was invited to the relay forlife survival dinner and shared a table with an elderly ladywho quickly became a friend.  She told me she was diagnosed in 1986 and has survived 26 years with this disease.  She had a masectomy but no radiation or chemo.  i wanted to share that with everyone who is having a down day.  That seems to be a great bit of news.
Posts.Title: survival info

Posts.Content: i hope your biopsy offers you good news, but if not know that some of us have done the chemo and are doing remarkably well.  i was diagnosed in march 2011 and did my treatments, am still living alone and tending all my own needs.  this includes lawn care, oil changes, gutter cleaning.  my husband has passed away and i learned alot of extra chores that he always did.  tomorrow ita down to camp to winterize it to the best of m ability.   good luck and keep your chin up
Posts.Title: just got the bad news...

Posts.Content: what is CSCI
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: actually i had several of these shots. never developed a ras, but god the fatigue from this shot was unreal  for me it was worse than the day after chemo.  I never got sick from them but was just really weak. for now I am done with the shots but i remember wanting to sew and feeling like the needle beside me was just to hard to lift. good luck with your shots
Posts.Title: Neulasta side effects

Posts.Content: I am stage 4 er+ pr+her2+ been treated for a year now and the last bone scan showed much lighter disease on the screen.  Dr. was very impressed.  Had very, very minor problems during treatment except for the neulasta shot, that made me very weak and tired for a day or two.  Minimal nausea  which is most feared during chemo.  My team at the cancer clinic is super fantastic.  I hope everyone has such a great team when dealing with cancer.  They say it's like diabetes, you can't cure stage4  but you can treat it.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: what you do will not be a wrong move if you do it with the love in your heart.  how could you know the right move?  seems like thee docs are even questioning themselves and they have years of experience.  on a good note, i was diagnosed stage 4 in feb 2011 and i am going strong still.   the only thing keeping me from going back to work is the pain in my back and the inability to lift heaavy loads my job required that constantly, i was a factory laborer.  i admire your dedication and please keep us posted on your school status everyone on this site will be cheering for you.
Posts.Title: Lost, Alone, and in Need of Advice

Posts.Content: I was taken off armidex because it did such a number on my bones  letrazole did the same thing to me.  Now i am on an aromatase inhibitor, it has the side effects but does't seem quite as bad.
Posts.Title: SIDE EFFECTS FROM ARIMADEX

Posts.Content: HOW RIGHT YOU ARE.  mY BODY JUST COULDN'T FUNCTION.  COULDN'T GET OUT OF A CHAIR THE PAIN IN MY KNEES WAS SO BAD, I HELD THEM AND PUSHED UP AS BEST I COULD.  PEOPLE WERE SAYING GET A CANE SO I DON'T FALL IF THEY GIVE OUT ON ME.  IT'S A USELESS LIFE ON THAT DRUG.
Posts.Title: Anastrolle

Posts.Content: Hi springflowers i have read many of your articles on cancer compass.  I am wondering where you find theFucoidan . I live in PA. and have not been able to locate it at any pharmacy or GNC center.  could you please share this info with me.  Thanks  pipperpain
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: .Thankyou will definitely check it out.  I believe vitamin b 17 is illegal in U S though. ANyway thank  you for your input i appreciate it.   pipperpain
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: what is CSCI
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed at stage 4b. c. over a year ago.  did the chemo. no radiation yet.   Last scans showed impressive improvement.  New scans due May 8th   so time will tell.  We probably have alot in common.  Chemo, insurance claims,  great chemo staff at the cancer center, family and friends rooting for us.  And i've been able to part with the headgear for now,  you will too.
Posts.Title: Do I have anything in common with you ?

Posts.Content: I am stage 4 b.c. and the doctors said i responded amazingly well to the chemo.  it's been 2 yrs for me sincw starting treatment,   i never took vitamins before, but now faithfully take my daily plus calcium and vitamin d.   the herceptin seems to be working for me.   check this sites message board for alternative treatments, they may help.   good luck to you linda
Posts.Title: stage iv help

Posts.Content: i complained to my onc in feb about the pain   i was having and she blew me off.  When i went in may and she saw that i could barely get out of the chair, she said dtop it immediately.  My yests showed that my back and  knees were riddled with arthiriitis.  I do not doubt that i had minor arthiritis before, i'm 59 but they never commented on it from my previous tests.  And how do you tell arthiritis from cancer when you look at a scan?? She wants me to wait 2 weeks and then try femara.  i am enjoying the 2 week wait, as the pain is subsiding a bit.  My feet ankles and knees were the worst.  At times my thumb will not even bend unless i use my other h and and bend it, which is very painful.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: quit arimidex and aromasin and was put on shots that have NO side effects for me.  i've been where you are and truthfully i could only mention you forgot the knee pin which wasx the worst for me.  good luck
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: my stage 4 did not show up in a mammo either.  it was not until my breasr lost its normal shape that i noticed and saw a dr.  lots of tests revealed stage 4.  still there was no  pain  just a goofy looking breast.  that was in March of 2011.  there are alot of people on here whose cancer did not show up on a mammo.  hang in there and hope for the best.  they were thinking 6 mos. for me and its been 3 yrs and 6 months
Posts.Title: Mamogram did not show stage 4 breast cancer

Posts.Content: MERRY CHRISTMAS TO ALL MY FRIENDS AT CANCER COMPASS. MAY YOUR DAY BE THE BEST ONE THAT YOU HAVE HAD IN A LONG WHILE  LOVE YOU LOTS   LINDA
Posts.Title: MERRY CHRISTMAS

Posts.Content: can anyone who has used this dryg give me any insight as to the side effects
Posts.Title: looking for info on progeta from ppl who have been on it

Posts.Content: i lost my mom to b cancer also.   But knowing i would lose her gave me precious time with her.  We watched alot of matlock repeats.  I like half houor comedies, but she liked matlock and in the heat of the night so that is what we did every day. we watched repeats of the repeats.  But we had our time together.  I also tried to make her favorite foods and when she had a bottle of ensure,  I added butterscotch ice cream topping to make it taste great.  I did what i could and i am so grateful i did now.  I am sorry for what you are going thru but I promise you will have no regrets when it is all said and dun.  Even a weekly visit will mean alot  and sometimes near the end mom just wanted to sleep. but she woould open her eyes to see if someone was there with her. good luck
Posts.Title: My Mum Has Terminal Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: so sorry for your unfortunate ordeal.  i was rxd in feb of 2011 when my b.c. was found it was already stage 4  mets to the bones.  from my spine to my feet basically spots everywhere. no surgery for me since it was stage 4.   i did my  chemo and it has been 4 years now. doing very well.   i no longer work as doing the heavy lifting and 8 hrs of standing are impossible for me.  yes  a tubby lil boss from behind his desk said those women dont need to sit down to do their part checks and he took our stools away.LOL .  i was rxd as triple positive,  and once a month i get zometa to keep my bones strong and herceptin for the her2 positive aspect of the cancer.  i live  in PA.  if i can help in any way feel free to private message me if you want.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Mets to the Bones

Posts.Content: so sorry for your unfortunate ordeal.  i was rxd in feb of 2011 when my b.c. was found it was already stage 4  mets to the bones.  from my spine to my feet basically spots everywhere. no surgery for me since it was stage 4.   i did my  chemo and it has been 4 years now. doing very well.   i no longer work as doing the heavy lifting and 8 hrs of standing are impossible for me.  yes  a tubby lil boss from behind his desk said those women dont need to sit down to do their part checks and he took our stools away.LOL .  i was rxd as triple positive,  and once a month i get zometa to keep my bones strong and herceptin for the her2 positive aspect of the cancer.  i live  in PA.  if i can help in any way feel free to private message me if you want.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Mets to the Bones

Posts.Content: I was married 40 years.  I think also, that my husband had more to deal with than he could handle with my cancer.  He scheduled all his vacation days totake me to my chemo treatments.  He died od a massive heart attack the night of my first chemo.  Everyone was telling me the stress of dealing with it was too much for him.  We never knew he had a heart problem.  Anyway, enjoy your husband whatever the deal is, we get no guarantees for tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Husbands

Posts.Content: what state does she live in? some states have a breast and cervical cancer treatment and protection plan that pays for all treatments.  Call a womans health center in your area and question it, or question at the onco,s office   BEST OF LUCK
Posts.Title: HELP PLEASE!!!

Posts.Content: anyone on xoleta  and how are the side effects for you??
Posts.Title: xoleta

Posts.Content: Honey cancer does take a toll on the body.  I was diagnosed stage 4 breast cancer over a year ago.  It was also found in my bones spine hips and feet.  I am here to tell you that over a year later after chemo, no radiation yet,  I am still driving cooking doing laundry and enjoying my grandkids.I was diagnosed at 58yrs old  my main symptom was back and foot pain.  Your Mom may be major depressed because not knowing can be very frightening.  They will find the right treatment and give her the best oppurtunity to beat it.  She needs words of encouragement, and hopefully there are family members that will step in and give you a helping hand.  Best of luck
Posts.Title: Please help...

Posts.Content: Hey Newbie I am stage 4 breast cancer.  They found uptake in my thigh spine ribs and feet.  The very good news is after chemo and a year i am in remission they can't find spots anywhere. There are several types of breast cancer, i am triple positive.  The oncologist was amazed at how well i responded.  I even saw a major hospital oncologist for a second opinion and he was also impressed by the results on the new scans.  More than likely the spot on your spine is a site from the breast cancer .  Hey keep the faith  i did very well.  Best of luck, this is a very good site to ask questions to people wo have been there.    GOOD LUCK
Posts.Title: Newbie - PET Scan Showing lesions in bone of Spine

Posts.Content: i have stage 4 breast cancer and have had taxil.  i did lose my hair. also very mild diaherra for a day or two, to me chemo was not as bad as everyone seems to think. i am 59 and have scans scheduled for the middle of nov.  My doctor has told me this is not curable but like diabetes it can be treated.  There is mild pain in my back and my feet where the cancer has spread to-
Posts.Title: side effects of Taxol

Posts.Content: in march 2011 i was rxd with stage 4 triple positive breast cancer.  at that point the onc told me no surgery cause it had spread.  Now after all the chemo he is suggwsting i have surgery as it is thought the main tumor sends growth messages to the secondary tumors to grow.  ANyone else have any drs. suggesting this.  Why wasn't it an option 15 months ago.. i'm so confused.  Thanks for any input you may offer.
Posts.Title: surgery after 15 months

Posts.Content: arimidex takes its toll on our bones. good luck with it, i've been there.  in my opinion  it aint worth it.
Posts.Title: ARIMIDEX NEW USER -PAIN

Posts.Content: has anyone with stage 4 her2 positive b.c. been told they will be on herceptin long term.. I have read that it is a 1 year treatment and they are continuing it for me as long as  my heart can handle it.  I question if this is really the procedure that other treatment centers are follwing.  any input will be appreciated
Posts.Title: herceptin use

Posts.Content: i was diagnosed with stage 4 bc in feb 2011. i did my chemo and i am doing fantastic.  go to your treatment your future may depend it.  i am moving aroubnd find, living alone, and tending to all my own needs.  This would not be the case if i had not done the chemo
Posts.Title: I need encouragement to go to chemo on monday

Posts.Content: i'm guessing maybe you are just starting chemo.  is that true?  I'm not sure what FEC is.  I did the chemo for stage 4 bc. and the first treatment was the worst.  Hopefully things  will get better for you.  Stick with this site.  it is great for sharing tips and feelings. everyone who comments is truly caring.  good luck
Posts.Title: Feel crap!

Posts.Content: my onc suggested that i be sure to get my calcium and vitamin d3.  he also gives me zometa to strengthen my bones.  i was rxd in feb 2011 and seem to be holding my own as of today. i do have some pain, but it has been 5 1/2 yrs since i was rxd at stage 4.  i feel that my dr. is doing a great job taking care of me.  i do also take potassium and magnesium to help me out plus a mult vitamin.
Posts.Title: Stage 4 Gals with Bone Mets

Posts.Content: For anyone who will respond --how long have patients been on this treatment and what was the procedure for receiving it?    I'm wondering what standard procedure is and if there is one.   Thanks in advance
Posts.Title: herceptin treatment for her II + cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks this was verified at my last chemo visit.  I am Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection,email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines athttp://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html    if you care to keep in touch
Posts.Title: herceptin treatment for her II + cancer

Posts.Content: I am a stage 4  breast cancer survivor.  diagnosed in feb 2011.  My major problem is cramping in calves, thighs and fingers never had cramping problems before.  It is major painful because the cancer treatment has slowed me down immensely and it takes several minutes to get in a standing position to put pressure on the cramped area.  Anyone else with these problems, or any solutions, besides eat bananas..  any suggestions appreciated
Posts.Title: cramping a year after chemo / breast cancer

Posts.Content: THANKS FOR YOUR RESPONSE, I am on esterogen blockers.   The cramps have subsided considerably.  I was and am hooked on Mountain Dew.  4 cans a day.  i have given it up for gator ade.  The bananas did not seem to help enough.  Two days ago i woke up with one but it was minor, first one in several days, what a relief.  The armidex did a number on my bones so i can't get up quick to stand down and relieve the pain, but as i said they seeem to have subsided.  and i lied, I still sneak a moountain dew occasionally just never 4 a day anymore.  lol
Posts.Title: cramping a year after chemo / breast cancer

Posts.Content: i do not understand the non small cell aspect  but i can assure you that stage 4 b.c. is not an immediate death sentece.  i was rxd with stage 4 triple positive b.c. in feb 2011 and i am still here today caring for myself.  i can drive takce care of my house and babysit a lil guy before school and sometimes after. i do my own shopping etc.  in 5 yrs mytumor markers have barely moved.  to date it has only been found in my bones lymph and breast.  i do not understand why they are saying no chemo. i had my rounds back in 2011 and you could actually see visual changes that showed it was working.  would she consider a second opinion
Posts.Title: Someone please help me. My mom was just diagnosed with Stage 4.

Posts.Content: Thanks it appears that i will receive it til the last week of Feb.  That makes a total of 1 yr.  this was verified on my last visit thanks for your response.  Good luck with your health.  I am Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection,email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines athttp://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html  if you care to communicate.
Posts.Title: herceptin treatment for her II + cancer

Posts.Content: i was rxd at stage 4    over 3years ago.  Every year my mammo came back fine.  Don't trust mammos.  Mine was found though on an ultrasound only after it had already spread to the bones
Posts.Title: confused

Posts.Content: Never really had a problem with ankles swelling except for one day.  I think I over did it that day.  Probably depends on the different meds that they use.  I didn't have trouble with nausea either.  I was just tired after a follow up shot.(Nuelasta)
Posts.Title: swelling of the ankles

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for the upbeat message.  You are right, there is so much info on the internet and some is very outdated.  My cancer had moved into my bones but that is the only place that they found mets.  I did my chemo treatment and to date it seems to be in remission.  My husband did the research when we first found out. Unfortunately, he had a massive heart attack the night of my first chemo, he was gone in a heartbeat.   Just goes to show when you think things can't get worse, there is always something else you may have to deal with.  Best of luck to your wife, i Hope she appreciates having a spouse there who cares and will help her get through it all.  Bless you both, it's hard on the spouse also.
Posts.Title: stage 4 triple positive breast cancer

Posts.Content: I am stage 4 breast cancer and YES with dense breasts you should be concerned.  I had my yearly mamos and it was never detected til the pain hit my bones, then it took another 14 months to determine it was cancer.  To put it simply my mamos were blown off as clean.  If the drs. can say you need a mamo, then say you have dense breasts but no cancer is showing up they are acting irresponsible.  Dense breasts require further testing.  I was not rxd til i was stage 4 and i found it myself even though i had mamos.  My breast took on a unusual shape and that is what made me suspicious.  I had 4 lumps with the largest being 4 centimeters, and it didn't show up on a mamo   none of the 4 lumps did.  when it was confirmed my option was chemo.  No need for radiation or surgery as it had spread thru my body.  Please, with dense breasts check beyond mamos and do your exams  GOOD LUCK
Posts.Title: Dense breast tissue

Posts.Content: Has anyone been diagnosed with stage 4 triple positive breast cancer and survived for any length of time?  I need to know this to know if it is worth the fight and how it will effect my future.  Would you please share your knowledge withme.  i am interested in triple positive stage 4
Posts.Title: stage 4 triple positive breast cancer

Posts.Content: i was diagnosed feb 2011.  Had it in my thigh, feet and a rib.  6 months later it was not visible on rib but found on ilia(new site).  the herceptin is to be a 1 yr treatment, but i was told i was doing so well they were keeping me on it.  After i more treatment they took me off, said my heart was getting bad.  I guess the philosophy is better to die of cancer than heart problems.  lol  I also switched insurances  so maybe they won't pay for it.  New test results on the 24th, tests are done already,  just waiting to see doctor.
Posts.Title: stage 4 triple positive breast cancer

Posts.Content: i experienced mild itching since taking this drug.  but i had a medicine for itching fro about 6 yrs ago and this wrked for me.  I only need it 1 pr 2 times a month and the onc has no trouble filling it as needed.
Posts.Title: Arimidex and itching, hip pain and sciatica

Posts.Content: Honey get a second opinion and don't wait 6 months
Posts.Title: Please Help!!!

Posts.Content: oops, that was doc, not dic  lol
Posts.Title: unusual feeling in breast, kinda like a fluid trickle on the inside

Posts.Content: thanks for the upbeat message.  Life can be strange at times and i was having one of those days.  thanks again
Posts.Title: stage 4 triple positive breast cancer

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for the upbeat message.  You are right, there is so much info on the internet and some is very outdated.  My cancer had moved into my bones but that is the only place that they found mets.  I did my chemo treatment and to date it seems to be in remission.  My husband did the research when we first found out. Unfortunately, he had a massive heart attack the night of my first chemo, he was gone in a heartbeat.   Just goes to show when you think things can't get worse, there is always something else you may have to deal with.  Best of luck to your wife, i Hope she appreciates having a spouse there who cares and will help her get through it all.  Bless you both, it's hard on the spouse also.
Posts.Title: stage 4 triple positive breast cancer

Posts.Content: in feb 2011 i was rxd with triple positive stage 4 b.c.  i have done the herceptin, very well tolerated, still getting it once a month.  while it was stage 4 there were no plans for surgeryor radiation.  to date there have been no new spots show up on tests.  doing well right now.  best of luck to you
Posts.Title: HER2/Neu protein positive breast cancer

Posts.Content: does anyone know what tis is telling me  i am stage 4 triple positive, and have been doin gwell for 3 yrs.  now i have this unusuak feeling and the dic just kinda brushed it off.
Posts.Title: unusual feeling in breast, kinda like a fluid trickle on the inside

Posts.Content: hi vickie,   i'm linda  stage 4  triple positive breast cancer for over 3 yrs now.  stay positive.  we are all terminal we just never know when our time will be up. you dwell on the cancer but in reality something else might  happen first.  my husband was bent on getting me well, said he's sell the camp and land to get me the treatment i needed although we did have insurance, it wasn't the best.  guess what.   he died of a massive heart attack the night of my first chemo treatment.  we had no idea he had any heart trouble.  but i did the chemo therapy because that is what he would have wanted. and 3 years later-- no toe tag yet.  Anyone can worry themseves sick, you need to dwell on the positive.  my daughter has extreme anxiety attacks and i do know what she goes thru so i can sympathize with you on that . Stage 4 does not mean an immediate end.  since i started treatment 3 yeas ago the fda has approved 2 new treatments to deal with stage 4 breast cancer.  we have to try to say 1 step ahead of the game.  i have 2 new drugs waiting for me if what i get fails me.  my nurse told me don't worry if 1 treatment doesn't work there's a whole list to try. stay positive for your own good.  oh and i did alot of vitamins etc.  but i made no mjor changes in my diet.  my doctor told me to keep doing what i am doing cause it is working, and i told him we must assume coca cola cures cancer.  lol   i'll check back in a day or two and see if you are feeling better
Posts.Title: Dealing with Stage IV metastic cancer and the emotions that come with it.

Posts.Content: if you were on facebook i would click like for this comment i am a 3 yr survivor ofstage 4 bc
Posts.Title: Dealing with Stage IV metastic cancer and the emotions that come with it.

Posts.Content: thank you for sharing
Posts.Title: Dealing with Stage IV metastic cancer and the emotions that come with it.

Posts.Content: thank you for sharing
Posts.Title: Dealing with Stage IV metastic cancer and the emotions that come with it.

Posts.Content: THERE MAY BE NO SYMPTOMS, BUT FORTUNATELY YOUR DOCTOR IS ON YOUR CASE AND WILL BE ALERT.  I WAS DIAGNOSED AT STAGE 4 AND THERE WERE NO SYMPTOMS EXCEPT A FUNNY LOOKING BOOB. THAT LED ME TO MY GENERAL PRACTIONER.  the pain in my back and feet were chalked up to standing on my feet all day at work,  The bone doctor blew me off even though my scans showed hot spots and uptake deposits.  My point is that you have a doctor that can stay on top of things with you.  I am stage 4 but doing very well.  Yesterday i climbed a ladder and renailed some flashing that was loose on my mothers home.  I live alone and 100% take care of myself.  I was rxd over a year ago.
Posts.Title: breast spread to bone

Posts.Content: yesterday marked 3 years since my diagnosis of stage 4 triple positive breast cancer.  i am doing extremely well like i'm not sick at all and getting about doing all my own things.  Just bought a new car.  i wanted to share this for anyone newly diagnosed  and to cheer anyone up who my be feeling down.  keep your chin up
Posts.Title: encouragement for all

Posts.Content: thank you
Posts.Title: encouragement for all

Posts.Content: finda doctor you trust and he will guide you in the right direction, they know the best options
Posts.Title: decisions

Posts.Content: has anyone with this disease felt strange movements in their breast / like a trickling movement. i've been rxd for over 3 yrs but this just started.  at first i thought it was my phone vibrating but my phone wasn't on my chest when i went to pick it up, now it feels like an bug walking on your skin, but it is inside.  i hope someone can respond to help me understand
Posts.Title: stage 4 breast cancer triple +

Posts.Content: i also suffer this side effect  it may never go away i was told by dr.  I have found wearing socks makes a big difference as i never wore them before areound the house. it either keeps the area padded or warmer, for some reason it helps me why not try it  and good luck
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: your hair truly is not a major factor in the whole picture.  mine grew back within 6 weeks of ending surgery.  it was short and curly, not like it was before.  you can make jokes about it and it gets easier.  i prepared a meal for my daughters family and told my grandson "now if you find a hair in your food, you know it ain't mine" and he said" yeah gramma but the only other character here with  hair is your dog".   i pulled out a clump in front of my family to show them, and my 2 yr old granddaughter walked around for days trying to pull hers out.  Find a way to laugh and it won't feel so strange.  the worst part i had was my head was always so cold  i couldn't handle wigs, i was bald in the house and wore doorags if i went out.
Posts.Title: Scared about losing hair

Posts.Content: your hair truly is not a major factor in the whole picture.  mine grew back within 6 weeks of ending surgery.  it was short and curly, not like it was before.  you can make jokes about it and it gets easier.  i prepared a meal for my daughters family and told my grandson "now if you find a hair in your food, you know it ain't mine" and he said" yeah gramma but the only other character here with  hair is your dog".   i pulled out a clump in front of my family to show them, and my 2 yr old granddaughter walked around for days trying to pull hers out.  Find a way to laugh and it won't feel so strange.  the worst part i had was my head was always so cold  i couldn't handle wigs, i was bald in the house and wore doorags if i went out.
Posts.Title: Scared about losing hair

Posts.Content: Sometimes the doctors can tell from the lymph nodes if the cancer has spread.  I'm sure if they were in douobt they would test further.
Posts.Title: Sister with breast cancer

Posts.Content: would a walker help support her? or a portable bedside potty? i am stage 4 b.c. and i know the weak feeling. i was diagnosed 3 years ago yesterday and i am doing really well.  i am a seamstress and remember looking at my sewing and feeling the needle was just to heavy to liftduring my chemo treatments.  unreal but true.  that was during my major chemo, your mom's weakness will hopefully pass just as my weakness did.  chemo can be tough but it is a short period of our lives that we deal with it.  wishing her well
Posts.Title: Please help deal with extreme weakness

Posts.Content: i am led to believe that itching is a sign of cancer-- although a sign of other diseases as well.  I am a third generation cancer patient and havae seen ist hand my grandfather and my father anad myself deal wwith this itching. My mother also a cancer patient had this discomfort but handled it well with lanacane. I was told i had anxiety isses and was given atarax before being dx'd with stagae 4 b cancer.  I also had bone scans and was told i had metatarsil aductis causing the pain in my feet even though the scan results showed uptake and hot spots. i guess it was too much trouble for the bone dr to look at the tests.  A new hospital system found the cancer within days of my mamogram. they were great. General practioner on feb 16, breast test feb 18 surgeon feb 19  chemo started mar 4.  I won't go back to the old hosp again.  I could have been treated 14 mos. earllier if the dr had looked at the test results.
Posts.Title: Itchy Skin All Over Body

Posts.Content: i was rxd with stage 4 b c  three yrs ago.  i can relate to her extreme tireness.  please tell her to hang in there.  bacause now i feel great. i get i treatment a  month and feel cold the day after.  that is my only reaction to the treatments now.  please tell your mom to hang in there .   i did not have surgery, they don't do that for stage 4, but i did the chemo and felt so tired that as a seastress i would look at the needle and felt it i was just to weak to lift it.( No kidding)  but now i am sewing to my hearts content.  best wishes for you and your mom
Posts.Title: Please help deal with extreme weakness

Posts.Content: I was only diagnosed at stage 4 but they treated me with chemo and they feel it is in partial regression the last scans were good.  So stage 4 is not a death sentence, but rather the opportunity to take control.  My cancer center staff is great.  The chemo was not too bad for me.  Mild nausea and always very cold.  I wore my fleece robe to walk the dog in July. (lol). the neighbors probably thought i was really losing it.  Anyway, I feel very good right now and i am only getting the herceptin 1x every 3 weeks.  I get cold for a day or two but definitely no nausea.
Posts.Title: MY MOTHER NOW HAS STAGE 4 BREAST CANCER

Posts.Content: Recently started having cramps inmy toes fingers legs and jaw.   I started sewing againand it seems that causes my fingers to cramp, i wonder if i'm tslking to much that i get jaw cramps.  I have stage 4 b.c. but am having very little pain. The cramps just started this week been diagnosed since February.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else suffer from severe muscle pains from spinal mets???????

Posts.Content: I was only diagnosed at stage 4 but they treated me with chemo and they feel it is in partial regression the last scans were good.  So stage 4 is not a death sentence, but rather the opportunity to take control.  My cancer center staff is great.  The chemo was not too bad for me.  Mild nausea and always very cold.  I wore my fleece robe to walk the dog in July. (lol). the neighbors probably thought i was really losing it.  Anyway, I feel very good right now and i am only getting the herceptin 1x every 3 weeks.  I get cold for a day or two but definitely no nausea.
Posts.Title: MY MOTHER NOW HAS STAGE 4 BREAST CANCER

Posts.Content: I wanted to let you know i am stage 4 was diagnosed at stage 4, i went through the chemo.  Yes they cannot cure stage 4 but i have been diagnosed for 16 mos. I am doing very well and my last test st mris etc showed no sign of mets.  It's probably there but very small and in remission.  So stage 4 is not an immediate death sentence.  I have told my family if i need them i will aask.  I do not want to over burden them now. good luck to you and your friend.
Posts.Title: Friend diagnosed with breast cancer - some advise, concerns, please help

Posts.Content: i am stage 4 also. live in pa and am walking the same walk as you.  i never took vitamins but now take my daily plus extra calcium and d-3.  Gatorade and bananas help with the leg pain.  your magnasium or potassium may be low.  I TOOK 3 pills to fight the estrogen positive cancer including femora. they all had the same side effects, to the point that i could not get out of a chair.  they found a shot- once a month and it is a godsend. Falsodex injection 1x a month when i get my bone enhancer.  MY DISCOMFORT IS TRULY ONLY ABOUT 5 TO 10 PERCENT OF WHAT I FELT ON THE PILLS.  I WAS ALSO GIVEN OXYCODONE AND FOUND THE SIDE EFFECTS ARE WORSE FOR ME THAN THE PAIN.  i feel hung over for about 24 hrs after taking a 5mg.  i took darvocet years ago as needed for arthiritis pain.  they took it off the market in u.s. sad it worked so much better for me with no side effects.  i am presently amazing the docs, no new masses in 27 months. was rxd at stage 4 so no surgery for me.  keep your chin up and perhaps question the shot, it was a miracle worker for me.   good luck
Posts.Title: Breast/Bone Stage 4

Posts.Content: i also suffer this side effect  it may never go away i was told by dr.  I have found wearing socks makes a big difference as i never wore them before areound the house. it either keeps the area padded or warmer, for some reason it helps me why not try it  and good luck
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: i wwas on an 18 wk course of carboplatin paxatore(or something like that) and a one yr course of Herceptin(once every 3 wks),  was triple positive.  Had a dr. appt on fri. he said i was doing so well he'd like to keepme on the herceptin awhile longer since my scans are showing major improvement.  Wish you could use my cancer center crew--they are great--  Good luck with the treatment, i am feeling so well i wish i could go back to work, but the cancer is in several spots on my spine and I must stand for 8 hrs. and do heavy lifting while bending.  no hope for my old job.  I am doing alot of sewing and knitting.
Posts.Title: MY MOTHER NOW HAS STAGE 4 BREAST CANCER

Posts.Content: i was diagnosed with stage 4 breast cancer also-- i amdoing well--but i can associate with your muscle pain.  I never had cramps more than onc eor twice a yr, but now i wake often with them perhaps potassium rich foods may help9bananas and potato skins) my potassium levels are always low since chemo, but undetectable unless blood work is done.  GOOD LUCK
Posts.Title: Does anyone else suffer from severe muscle pains from spinal mets???????

Posts.Content: i have been diagnosed with stage 4 b c   was stage 4 when found 18 mos ago.   I recently had an aannoying pressure under my arm and the docs are telling mr swollen lymph nodes.   i have not had any reason for them to be swollen (no infections)  Does any one with stage 4 knowledge have any input for me
Posts.Title: swollen lymph nodes in stage 4 breast canxer

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with stage 4 also. Had my yearly checks and the local hospital found nothing. After a bone scan for severe pain, I even went to an orthopedic specialist because of pain in my foot bones.  He told me I had metarsal aductus and I was born with it. Had me fitted for special foot inserts.  After being diagnosed with stage 4 and it being in my spine and feet, I asked the local hospital for a copy of my bone scan.  14 months before diagnosis I had hot spots and (if i'm quoting this correctly) uptake deposits in my bones.  I don't think the orthopedic dr. even looked at my scan.  Anyway, I started treatment in March. 18 weeks of chemo, 1 day of treatment every 3 weeks.  The treatment did not make me unbearably sick.  Mild nausea and cold.  Then a very mild treatment for 11 more  times(again 1 time every three weeks), I'll finish up this March.  Doctors are encouraged the tumors appear to be shrinking.  Anyway, i was told that I've had the cancer for years.  Why I had to change hospitals for it to be found is beyond me.  They are doing alot to treat this even in stage 4, but I know how you feel when things are not properly checked by professionals.  Lots of luck with your MOM.
Posts.Title: MY MOTHER NOW HAS STAGE 4 BREAST CANCER

Posts.Content: i wwas on an 18 wk course of carboplatin paxatore(or something like that) and a one yr course of Herceptin(once every 3 wks),  was triple positive.  Had a dr. appt on fri. he said i was doing so well he'd like to keepme on the herceptin awhile longer since my scans are showing major improvement.  Wish you could use my cancer center crew--they are great--  Good luck with the treatment, i am feeling so well i wish i could go back to work, but the cancer is in several spots on my spine and I must stand for 8 hrs. and do heavy lifting while bending.  no hope for my old job.  I am doing alot of sewing and knitting.
Posts.Title: MY MOTHER NOW HAS STAGE 4 BREAST CANCER

Posts.Content: i am stage 4  have been for almost 4 yrs now.  my tumor markers were always in the mid 20s  now they are slowly starting to climb.  i am wondering just how high they can go.  i am told i am still in the normal range  but climbing.  any info is appreciated.  they wanted to do a pet scan  but medicare will only pay for 2 of them in a lifetime  so i'm screwed there
Posts.Title: seeking tumor marker info

Posts.Content: I have had 4 bone scans over the cousrse of my dx.  the first 3 showed bc cancer in different spots on my bones.the 4th said no signs of mets but i was told my knees and spine were riddled with arthiritis.  I am wondering how they determine the hot spots are arthiritis and not cancer.  Any input on this?  I was also told to get off the armidex immediately as it was causing so much pain i could barely get out of chair..  any comments appreciated.
Posts.Title: questioning bone scan results

Posts.Content: this is meant to be a very encouraging letter for you.  I was dxd in feb 2011 with stage 4 b.c.   My last ultrasound showed no sign of cancer in my breast.  Not sure about the bones as no test has been done recently.  I feel great.  i would like to go back to work to be busier, but as fate  has it they have recently dxd me with severe arthiritis and i can no longer do the standing for long periods and the heavy lifting required for factory labor.  Point is even at stage 4  they are doing wonderous things to maintain it.  Hang in there  i've been doing really great.  lots of love to you
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: i have stage 4 breast cancer , saw dr feb 16 2011, was seen by breast specialist that thurs for mamo,then sent to a   surgeon. then on Mar 4 i started my chemo.  the hospital staff was great and wasted no time.  The chemo hits all parts of your body why wouldn't they be giving you chemo to hit all areas?  And the chemo did not seem as bad for me as for most people.  I am 59 and feel like i handled it very well.  good luck if you find yourself being treated.  I wish you could use my doctor
Posts.Title: stage 4 treatment

Posts.Content: if you are having problems with your pancreas that may very well be the back pain.  Some meds can cause itchies.  being on the safe side you may need to talk to your onc even if it is just to ease your mind, then you won't have to dwell on it  GOOD LUCK
Posts.Title: Pain in upper rib thru to back

Posts.Content: it is amazing how we feel left out as we deal with this  monster.  But while i worked i was always running for my life work, family and home and hubby.  The rest of the world is still dealing with all that.  On a good day i sometimes ask a friend who works 11 to  7   to stop up and have breakfast with me.  we visit on the deck aand enjoy breakfast in the morning sunlight.    She gets outta cooking that day, we visit and she goes home and goes to sleep.  just a thought but it might help with the loniliness. good luck with your future.
Posts.Title: scared, depressed & overwhelmed

Posts.Content: i was diagnosed in 2011 with stage 4 b.c.   i went thru the chemo and have been doing very well.  now all i am hearing is that i am riddled with arthiritis.  they quit the armidex and started a shot once a month that is about the same.  my bones feel so much better.  When i wemt to see a bone doctor, he looked at my mris bone scans etc. and said he would question what the doctors thought was cancer as he sees it as a form of arthiritis.  i feel great but question if i had stage 4 cancer, because of the contradiction of the new doctor.  Any comments?  has this happened to anyone else?
Posts.Title: very confused about stage 4 bc
